Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can illustrate various plants and animals in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, lizards, squirrels, ants for land habitats, and fish, clams for water habitats.
The student can show comparisons by labeling different living things found in each habitat.
The student can use drawings to display patterns of plant and animal diversity in each habitat.
